conclusion: To determine when the two objects are farthest apart, analyze the area under the velocity-time graph.
The vertical axis represents velocity (v) and the horizontal axis represents time (t). Curves A and B represent velocities of Object A and Object B.
t1, t2, t3, and t4 are specific time points. At t2, both objects have the same velocity v0.
The displacement of each object at any time is the area under its respective curve from t = 0 to that time.
From 0 to t2, Object A has a higher velocity than Object B, so it covers more distance.
At t2, both objects have the same velocity, but Object A has traveled further up to this point.
After t2, Object B's velocity increases and surpasses Object A's velocity.
The maximum separation occurs when the difference in the areas under the curves is the greatest.
Before t2, Object A is ahead. After t2, Object B starts to catch up.
The separation is greatest at t2 because beyond this point, Object B begins to reduce the distance between them.
The two objects are farthest apart at time t2.
